result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Michael Senske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent.
Defendant to sign up for Probation.
Defendant remanded into custody.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes: 30 days for restitution request.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM644.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM644.
Not to possess a firearm.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by Agent.

-Domestic Abuse Assessment within 30 days and follow all recommendations.
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Marlo Hammer.
-Defendant to participate in Victim Empathy Seminar.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA if requested by Agent and follow any recommended treatment.

Condition time, 150 days STAYED.
Huber granted for work, treatment and medical appointments.

records.addlTxt:
CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Benjamin Michael Senske appeared. Case called at 11:15 am. Includes PRH on 15CM644 and SEH on 15CF528.  Atty Perrin recites agreement. No objection from ADA Kelly.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Counts #2, #3 and #4. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Counts #2, #3 and #4. Court dimisses Counts #1, #5, #6 and #7. ADA Kelly makes sentencing arguments. Atty Perrin makes sentencing arguments. Court orders - 2 yrs probation w/h 
On Count #2 - 90 Days i/s 
On Counts #3 and #4 - 60 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs
- Restitution to be determined. 
- DNA Surcharge (1) ; Apply Bond
- AODA
- Domestic Abuse Assessment
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No contact with M. Hammer
- Restorative Justice 
- Sign up for probation by 1:00 pm on 1/18/2017
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Counts to run concurrent to each other and 15CM644.
Court will not set any more Probation Review Hearings.
Fax: DOC. km

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Marlo H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
